result.execSummary:
The defendant Eddie P. Larrea was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
03:06 pm - Defendant Eddie P. Larrea in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moves to dismiss but read in Count 1 and amend Count 2 to Disorderly Conduct and amend Count 3 striking the Domestic Abuse component - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to Counts 2 and 3.  Plea questionnaire filed.    Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Bednar/Drewa/Defendant/Court statement to sentencing.  
Court Sentence - Counts 2 and 3 Concurrent
WHS/POP 18 months
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
Continue counseling until discharged by treatment provider
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Appeal rights given
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

ADDRESS INFO for Eddie P. Larrea
Current: 3594 Sunset Lane, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 04-14-2015)
Prior: 618-A Hewett Street, Neillsville, WI 54456

no intoxicants, no taverns, no contact w/Shyan D. Thundercloud except for contact via telephone for the limited purposes to make arrangements for mutual parenting responsibilities and to schedule and participate in counseling together

11:30 am - Defendant Eddie P. Larrea in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  State files Information.  Drewa in receipt of Information, waives reading and enters not guilty pleas.  Drewa/Bednar statement to motion to modify bond - Currently set as sig bond $2500 with conditions. - Court grants motion to allow further limited contact to allow for participating in counseling.  Bail continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
